column4: i try to connect my laptop directly to the WAN port but somehow i can't get an IP address from the router, how can i solve this problem? i tried this on windows i somehow get an IP address from the router
the DHCP server on the router is started
ubuntu behaves like windows in this regard. you connect the cable, and then it will try to get an IP via dhcp
i tried that but i don't get an IP address from the router, and in windows my laptop gets an IP address, that's the problem
are you sure the network port you're using will receive a dhcp response. and did you configure eth0 (lan) to use dhcp (or perhaps a static config)
it's not configure to use some sort of static configuration?
from the NetworkManager it is per default Automatic DHCP
in windows i see that the router has gave me an IP address
can you run ifconfig. and private message me (or use nopaste) the data for eth0 ?
this is the ifconfig data, that my wireless has right now (for example) http://nopaste.info/f858e0d19c.html

i can't copy the ifconfig result because i can't manage now to get internet on the laptop, but i don't have an "inet4 addr" line in the result, there is only "inet6 addr" in the result with an MAC address after it
it also says UP BROADCAST RUNNING MULTICAST...
i just wanted to check that it infact did not have a good ipv4 addr ;-)
just check that the lan cable actually get's a link active light (on pc/laptop or router).
also maybe try "sudo dhclient -r"   (it's supposed to check for dhcp). it that doesn't work try "sudo /etc/init.d/network restart"
and you doo see your network interface in the ifconfig list right? i.e. the kernel did detect and install your network card right? ;-)
